definition[0]: to write a letter to an organization to give an opinion, ask for information etc
example[0]: If you would like a copy of our fact sheet, please write in, enclosing a stamped addressed envelope.
example[1]: And so I wrote in to Radio Brighton.
definition[1]: to write a piece of information in the space provided for it on a form or document
example[2]: Provide some space for students to write in their hobbies.
definition[2]: to add someoneâ€™s name to the official list on your voting form, to show that you want to vote for them
example[3]: The campaign to write in Johnson for governor failed.
definition[3]: a vote you give to someone by writing their name on your ballot paper
